snippet: After the state had its credit rating downgraded again because of a pension debacle, Gov. Pat Quinn on Thursday called lawmakers into a special session “to finish the job.”
abstract: Illinois Gov Pat Quinn responds to state's credit rating being downgraded again by Moody's Investors Service because of a pension debacle, calling lawmakers into a special session 'to finish the job.'
lead_paragraph: After the state had its credit rating downgraded again because of a pension debacle, Gov. Pat Quinn on Thursday called lawmakers into a special session “to finish the job.”

headline.main: Illinois: Lawmakers Called Back to Fix Pension Shortfall
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Lawmakers Called Back To Fix Pension Shortfall

keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
keywords.name: subject
